question: In Alibe Bazin syndrome, origin of lymphoma is from:-
exp: - Alibe Bazin syndrome is the other name given for condition MYCOSIS FUNGOIDES. - MYCOSIS FUNGOIDES is the cancer arising from T-Cells - It is associated with cutaneous T-Cell lymphoma - Cutaneous T-Cell lymphoma, the tumor cells has high chances of skin infiltration called as EPIDERMOTROPISM & can also be present in the blood. - Findings of EPIDERMOTROPISM a PAUTRIERS MICROABSCESS - HALLMARK FEATURE of tumor cells a CEREBRIFORM NUCLEI. Tx- Steroids, UV Radiation, Vorinostat- Histone Deacetylase inhibitor.
topic_name: Neoplasm of Mature B & T Cells

question: Which of the following organ involvement is not commonly observed with CNS involvement in a patient with DLBCL?
exp: Diffuse large B cell lymphoma (DLBCL):- Arise sporadically or from transformation of a low grade lymphoma(eg:-Follicular lymphoma). (1) Present in adulthood as an enlarging lymph node or and extra nodal mass Patient with DLBCL with CNS involvement commonly involve organ like:- Renal, Adrenals, testis.
topic_name: Neoplasm of Mature B & T Cells

question: Post transplant lymphoma occurs due to proliferation of which of the following cells?
exp: Post transplant lymphoma (Post transplant Lymphoproliferative Disorder or PTLD) occurs due to proliferation of B cells
topic_name: Neoplasm of Mature B & T Cells

question: Which of the following is not a B cell neoplasm?
exp: Mycosis fungoides is a Mature T and NK cell neoplasm. Mature T and NK cell neoplasm T cell prolymphocytic leukemia Mycosis fungoides Sezary syndrome Aggressive NK - cell leukemia Systemic EBV 4 T - cell lymphoma of Childhood Adult T - cell leukemia/ lymphoma Follicular T - cell lymphoma
topic_name: Neoplasm of Mature B & T Cells
